content:
In view of the latest comments, and lack of response from the author, I've edited the puzzle as follows:

Output section
* Clarified the height and width of output needed.

Constraints section
* Changed the format of "coordinates" from {{constant}} to [[variable]].

Stub generator
* Changed "x" to "row".
* Changed "y" to "column".

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great for CoC, good mix with the "row - column" format

# clearer if you say "square" somewhere in the puzzle
OLD: Your supervisor asked you to recreate a map
NEW: Your supervisor asked you to recreate a square map

# because water can kill a tree, there might not be the same number of trees on the map
# also showing was misspelled
OLD: chowing nbTree trees symbolized by a + and nbWater tiles of water symbolized by a #
NEW: showing trees symbolized by a + and tiles of water symbolized by a #

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one ! Perfect for a COC

I'm pretty sure there are some extremely serious errors in the code. In the first Test Case, there is supposed to be a tree at (4,3) which there isn't. The map should look like this:
. . . . +
. # . . .
. + . . .
. . # . +
. . . . .

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is original and simple enough.

You misspelled system as 'sistem' and supervisor as 'suprevisor'.
Other than that, it seems like a decent little CoC game, nice job!

Goal section
* Please specify how the coordinate system works, e.g.
   • Where is (0, 0)?
   • Are you using a (row, column)-format or (x, y)-format?
   • Does row/y increase upwards or downwards?
   • Does column/x increase towards the left or the right?

* Some coordinates of the trees and water are the same in a single case. How should that be handled? Please EITHER specify in Goal section OR revise those cases.

Input section
* Please format nbTree as a [[variable]].
* Please format nbWater as a [[variable]].

Constraints section
* Please specify the lower limit of the variables too.
* Are all the coordinates of trees and water unique (no overlapping)? Please state so if that is the case (after revising the cases as mentioned above).
* Are all coordinates non-negative integers? If so, please state so.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer" or "write map").

Thanks.

You should read again the goal section... In the notes, "The coordinates are given in the "row column" format". In the  auto-generated code, the variables x and y might be confusing : in fact, the variable x represents the ordinate and the variable y the abscissa
Ok. Still, this should be changed as it has nothing to do with the goal of the game (plot a map) and it just adds complications for no reason.

Thank you for making the changes.

Would you please move the notes from Output section to Goal section?

Please also add notes on the coordinate format (as mentioned in my last comment).

Constraints section: Please remove the constraint on overlapping because it is not a constraint - it is an explanation of the output requirement (essentially a duplicate of one of the notes).

Thanks again.
Right, must be good now, feel free to comment if you see anything else ! thank you for all these tips

Thank you too.

I'm afraid the coordinate description is more confusing now! You mention "x-axis" and "y-axis", but the coordinates given in the inputs are in "[[row]] [[column]]" format, not in (x, y) format.

For example, the point 4 0 refers to the point at the intersection of the 4th row down, 0th column on the left. And that corresponds to 0 4 if rewritten in the (x, y) format (as you have written, x increases towards the right, y increases downwards).

I would suggest to

* Delete "X axis increases towards the right | Y axis increases downwards" (because that is implied from the positions of origin and bottom right corner).

* Add "The coordinates are given in the "[[row]] [[column]]" format." above "The origin (0,0) corresponds...".

Thanks again.
Thank you for the advice ! It is hard to explain for me so i will write it as you said, i think it will be easier for others to understand !
